```{r}
#| label: data-preprocessing
#| message: false
#| warning: false
library(tidyverse)   # includes dplyr, readr, stringr, …
library(readxl)
library(janitor)

## 1 ── Measles cases -------------------------------------------------------
measles_df <-
  read_csv("measles_cases.csv", show_col_types = FALSE) |>
  clean_names() |>
  select(state, confirmed_cases) |>
  mutate(state = str_trim(state))

## 2 ── Population ----------------------------------------------------------
pop_raw <-
  read_excel("SCPRC-EST2024-18+POP.xlsx",
             skip      = 4,
             col_names = FALSE)

population_df <-
  tibble(
    state      = str_trim(str_remove(pop_raw[[1]], "^\\.+")),
    population = as.numeric(pop_raw[[2]])
  ) |>
  filter(!state %in% c("United States", "Northeast", "Midwest",
                       "South", "West", "Puerto Rico")) |>
  drop_na(population)

## 3 ── Merge & derive severity --------------------------------------------
merged_df <-
  population_df |>
  left_join(measles_df, by = "state") |>
  mutate(
    confirmed_cases = replace_na(confirmed_cases, 0),
    severity        = round((confirmed_cases / population) * 1e5, 2),
    severity_bucket = case_when(
      severity == 0 ~ NA_character_,
      severity <= 1 ~ "1",
      severity <= 2 ~ "2",
      severity <= 3 ~ "3",
      severity <= 4 ~ "4",
      TRUE          ~ "5"
    )
  )
```

```{r}
#| label: data-visualisation
#| message: true
#| warning: false
library(usmap)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(sf)       # for st_coordinates()
library(scales)

cat("\n── Step 0: merged_df ──\n")
print(glimpse(merged_df))

## 1 ── US polygons (sf) ----------------------------------------------------
map_sf <- us_map(regions = "states")               # sf with a geometry column
cat("\n── Step 1: map_sf ──\n")
print(glimpse(map_sf))

## 2 ── Join polygons with severity (key in lower-case) ---------------------
map_merged <-
  map_sf |>
  mutate(state_lower = tolower(full)) |>
  left_join(
    merged_df |>
      mutate(state_lower = tolower(state)) |>
      select(state_lower, severity_bucket, severity),   # keep extra severity
    by = "state_lower"
  )

cat("\n── Step 2: map_merged ──\n")
print(glimpse(map_merged))

## 3 ── Centroids for labels (≥ 2 per 100 K) -------------------------------
centers_sf <-
  tibble(
    lon   = state.center$x,
    lat   = state.center$y,
    state = tolower(state.name),
    abbr  = state.abb
  ) |>
  usmap_transform()                                 # returns POINT geometry

cat("\n── Step 3: centers_sf ──\n")
print(glimpse(centers_sf))

label_df <-
  centers_sf |>
  inner_join(
    merged_df |>
      mutate(state_lower = tolower(state)) |>
      filter(severity >= 2) |>
      select(state_lower),
    by = c("state" = "state_lower")
  ) |>
  mutate(
    coords = st_coordinates(geometry),
    x = coords[, 1],
    y = coords[, 2]
  )

cat("\n── Step 4: label_df ──\n")
print(glimpse(label_df))

## 4 ── Five-colour palette -------------------------------------------------
pal <- c("1" = "#fef0d9",
         "2" = "#fdcc8a",
         "3" = "#fc8d59",
         "4" = "#e34a33",
         "5" = "#b30000")

## 5 ── Plot with black borders & boxed legend --------------------------------
ggplot(map_merged) +
  geom_sf(aes(fill = severity_bucket),          # polygons
          colour = "black", size = 0.4) +       # ← black state borders
  scale_fill_manual(
    values   = pal,
    na.value = "white",
    drop     = FALSE,
    name     = "Measles cases\n(per 100 K)"
  ) +
  geom_text(                                    # state abbreviations
    data        = label_df,
    aes(x = x, y = y, label = abbr),
    inherit.aes = FALSE,
    fontface    = "bold",
    size        = 3
  ) +
  coord_sf() +
  theme_void() +
  theme(
    legend.position   = "right",
    legend.background = element_rect(           # ← legend box border
      colour = "black", fill = "white", linewidth = 0.4
    )
  ) +
  labs(title = "Measles Severity by State (per 100 K) – 21 June 2025")
```
